page.title: 05OUNDLE PUBLIC SCHOOL 1
page.content: Oundle School is a boarding school for boys which has an international reputation. Its most famous old boy and master is currently Arthur Marshall who abandoned teaching to become writer and T.V. personality. The Grocers' Company also owns two day-schools in the town, Laxton School and Laxton Junior School. The junior school admits girls and the daughters of masters are now admitted into the Sixth Form of the senior school. It costs approximately Â£1,745 a term for basic tuition and board. The day-boys pay Â£700. These charges however do not include such items as books, sports gear or music lessons. The boys are normally expected to join the school at the age of eleven or thirteen. They are required to qualify academically by passing the Common Entrance Examination .../...
